variant-analysis/sars-cov-2.description: A demo of SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data analysis from sequenced reads in NCBI's SRA to called and annotated mutations for a batch of viral samples.

materials.title: From NCBI's Sequence Read Archive (SRA) to Galaxy: SARS-CoV-2 variant analysis

variant-analysis/sars-cov-2.title: From NCBI's Sequence Read Archive (SRA) to Galaxy: SARS-CoV-2 variant analysis

virology/sequencing-spectrum-viral-genom.title: Sequencing data analysis for a spectrum of viral genomes

variant-analysis/sars-cov-2-variant-disc.title: Mutation calling, viral genome reconstruction and lineage/clade assignment from SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data

variant-analysis/tb-variant-analysis/sli.description: Tuberculosis (TB) is an infectious disease caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis. According to the WHO, in 2018 there were 10.0 million new cases of TB worldwide and 1.4 million deaths due to the disease, making TB the world’s most deadly infectious disease.
variant-analysis/tb-variant-analysis/sli.title: M. tuberculosis Variant Analysis

variant-analysis/tb-variant-analysis/tut.description: Variation in the genome of M. tuberculosis (Mtb) is associated with changes in phenotype, for example drug resistance and virulence. It is also useful for outbreak investigation as the single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) in a sample can be used to build a phylogeny.
variant-analysis/tb-variant-analysis/tut.title: M. tuberculosis Variant Analysis

variant-analysis/trio-analysis/tutorial.description:
To discover causal mutations of inherited diseases it’s common practice to do a trio
analysis. In a trio analysis DNA is sequenced of both the patient and parents. Using this
method, it’s possible to identify multiple inheritance patterns.
variant-analysis/trio-analysis/tutorial.title: Trio Analysis using Synthetic Datasets from RD-Connect GPAP
